resources.string: Placeholder to test until text loaded.
Please enter a subscriber key (usually email address)
Receive alerts when you are located near a national park.

Attributes contain specific information about your subscribers, such as first and last name, gender, and geographical location.

You can assign specific information as part of a subscriber attribute to be used as part of sends or subscriber management.

This JB4A SDK Explorer stores first name and last name as attributes.
Your subscriber key provides a key for the Contact Record and can be used to tie together multiple channels/devices for each Contact.
Push and Location notifications are used to indicate whether this device is interested in receiving notifications or location messages.
Tags are used to specify which messages a customer wishes to receive. For example to receive messages for an interest in a particular activity.
The Open Direct Recipient will be used whenever an OpenDirect url is included with a message and the customer clicks on that message.
The CloudPage Recipient will be used whenever a CloudPage is included with a message and the customer clicks on that message.
The Notification Recipient will be used whenever a message is received and the customer clicks on that message.
The System Token is assigned by the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) service whenever pushEnabled() is called to uniquely identify this device and app to GCM.
The Device Id is a unique identifier for this device and is can be used by the Marketing Cloud to push messages to specific devices.

The App Keys are used to uniquely identify your app with the Marketing Cloud and with Google. The App Id and Access Token are defined in the App Center. The GCM Id is found in the Google Developers Console.

The following values are needed to send messages from this app. These are not normally found in an app that catches Push Notifications. But it provides a way to test this app directly.\n\nThe clientId and the clientSecret are the values found in the Salesforce Marketing Cloud App Center for the Server to Server App.

The messageId is found in the Marketing Cloud Message Center for the API Message which is a template for the message to send. This app overrides the values in the message to customize who receives the message as well as what is included in the message.
Any updates to any of these Preferences will take approximately 15 minutes to take effect. Before sending a message, you should wait 15 minutes for the new values to take effect.
Please enter an email address to send log data.\n\nPress OK to open an email client to send this data.
There are no email clients installed.
Please enable Push Notifications in Preferences before attempting to Send Messages
